title: Gunman opens fire in Georgia Walmart before killing himself
text:
This article, Gunman opens fire in Georgia Walmart before killing himself, originally appeared on CBSNews.com

A man who fired shots inside a Walmart store in Georgia early Saturday has died after he turned the gun on himself, police said. A 19-year-old man walked into the store in Waycross and started shooting before being confronted by police.

"Officers located the shooter within seconds, at which time he turned the handgun on himself, and delivered a self-inflicted gunshot wound," the Waycross Police Department said.

Police said there were workers and customers in the store at the time, but they were all evacuated and no one was hurt. The man was taken to a hospital and pronounced dead at around 3 a.m. Police identified him as 19-year-old John Jaylen Walker Kinnitt of Waycross.

Peter Brown told CBS affiliate WJAX-TV that he was picking up groceries in the store when he heard shots. After the first shot was fired, Brown said, people began scrambling.

"We're less than 20,000 people, you know like everybody knows everybody and you never expect something like this in a small town," Brown said.

WAYCROSS WALMART SHOOTING: Witness says shots were fired at store in Georgia | WJAX-TV https://t.co/jV9rdqVREG

— Alicia Tarancon (@AliciaANJax) October 26, 2019

Waycross is about 81 miles northwest of Jacksonville, Florida.
